guardians.model.entities

Class CycleShift

  • java.lang.Object
    • guardians.model.entities.AbstractDay
      • guardians.model.entities.CycleShift
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractDay>

    @Entity
 @ValidDayMonthYear
public class CycleShift
extends AbstractDay
    Doctors have some periodic shifts. This is, if some Doctors have a shift today, after a certain number of days, they will have another one. This kind of shifts will be referred to as "cycle-shift", and should not be confused with regular shifts. A "regular shift", or "shift" in short, refers to the shifts that will vary from month to month and that do not occur periodically. This way, the CycleShift Entity represents one recurring cycle-shift taken by several Doctors
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private @Range(min=1L,max=31L) java.lang.Integer day
      All three field day, month and year are used to identify from which day the cycle-shifts should be calculated For example, if we had started on Frebuary of 2020 with the following cycle: 1/2/2020: Sebastian and Diana 2/2/2020: Alex and Rasim 3/2/2020: Irati and Laura Then, the reference of the cycle-shift "Sebastian and Diana" would be: day=1 month=2 year=2020
      private @NotEmpty java.util.List<Doctor> doctors
      The List of Doctors that have this cycle-shift
      private @Range(min=1L,max=12L) java.lang.Integer month 
      private @Range(min=1970L) java.lang.Integer year
